name: slingshot

[ I ] in motor racing, to pass another car by driving behind it to gain speed using less power, before accelerating (= increasing speed) and moving past it : Stewart used the momentum to shift to the inside and slingshot around to the lead.
[ I or T ] to push something or someone somewhere with a lot of force, or to be pushed somewhere with a lot of force: The surfers used jet skis to provide them with the initial momentum to slingshot them onto the giant waves. The spaceship slingshot through space. Synonym
propel
[ I or T ] to cause someone or something to suddenly be in a particular situation, area of activity, etc., or to suddenly be in it: Somehow, this PR catastrophe slingshot her back onto the music charts. Candidates are going to have to win South Carolina to slingshot into that national primary. Synonym
propel
